name: #1 - Disaster Recovery in the Cloud / KubeCon Berlin Recap
description:
Hey folks,

our first meetup will center around KubeCon Berlin and Disaster Recovery.

Thomas Peitz - Infrastructure Engineer at InVision AG - will summarize what you missed at Cloud Native Conference / KubeCon 2017. Therefore he will demo some Kubernetes 1.6 features:
- Kubernetes Federation
- New Scheduling Opportunities

The second Talk is from Randy Gupta - GDG Organizer, Cloud Enthusiasts, Java Developer, Software Architect @ SCARATEC. Too big to fail? Wrong! The use of cloud technologies requires different backup and recovery strategies that traditional applications. This talk will deal with the challenges of disaster recovery in a cloud environment. 

Our Agenda:
18:00 - 19:00 - Dinner's ready
19:00 - 20:00 - Thomas Peitz - KubeCon 2017 Recap (Focus Kubernetes 1.6)
20:00 - 20:15 - Small break
20:15 - 21:00 - Randy Gupta - Disaster Recovery in the Cloud
21:00.... Clubmate, Beer and great discussions...  

Cheers!

GDG Cloud Düsseldorf

name: #2 Monoliths in Containers by Terry Ryan (Google)
description:
We, the GDG Cloud Düsseldorf, are organizing our next meetup on monday October 23rd at <a>InVision</a>.

We are awaiting our special guest Terry Ryan (Google, San Francisco). Terry is Developer Advocate for the Google Cloud Plattform and also Author of the book Driving Technical Change. 

Since Terry is in Europe, we managed to invite him to give a talk at our GDG and spend some time with us!

Terry’s talk will be:

Monoliths in Containers
There is momentum to moving container based systems instead of the traditional single machine (or virtual machine) model.  Where does that leave your mission critical monolith application? Can it be containerized?  Without tremendous amounts of pain? Of course it can.

Our Agenda:
18:00 - 19:00 - Dinner's ready
19:00 - 20:00 - Terry Ryan - Monoliths in Containers
20:00 … Clubmate, Beer and great discussions... 

Big thank you to our sponsor <a>InVision</a> to make this awesome meetup possible on such a short notice!

Cheers!
GDG Cloud Düsseldorf

name: Cloud Study Jam (Workshop, limited spots)
description:
What is it?
Learn the fundamentals of the Google Cloud Platform, how to run containers on it and how to use the platform for data engineering. Attendees get free access to the labs ($70+ value). No need to create a Google Cloud Platform account or register with a credit card.

How long does it take?
One in-person session of 3 hours, followed by 2-8 hours of self-study.

What is the end result?
Google-hosted badges like this:(https://google.qwiklabs.com/public_profiles/3707ebde-dc9a-47e6-8992-84a84a85b929)

that attendees can use in their online profiles and show to employers.

Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

Agenda:
6:30pm: Three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs
8:00pm: Break
8:30pm: Intro to Docker or Scientific Data Processing lab
22:00pm: Event ends

If you cannot make it please remove yourself from the list, so that others have the chance to join.

name: Istio / MFA for Kubernetes
description:
We, the GDG Cloud Düsseldorf, are organizing our next meetup on wednesday july 18th at InVision.

Robert Tingirică and Randy Gupta will give talks about the kubernetes ecosystem.

Randy’s will talk about: Service Meshes with Istio

When you’re operating multiple microservice within a cluster, you might eventually come to the point where you want to have more control over the connectivity between the microservices.

Which service is speaking to whom? Is the connection SSL secured? How can I trace requests to my application? Can I run canary tests on the microservices?

Istio is currently in version 0.8 and will most likely become GA within this year. So it is about time to have a look at it!

Robert’s will talk about:
MFA for kubernetes using android phones’ fingerprint reader
The challenges of implementing an identity provider for kubernetes and the benefits it brings. Is it worth connecting your phone to the cluster? Are biometrics the new norm for corporate security departments? These are the questions that Robert has tried to answer in his quest to implement such a system. He will present the problems faced during it.

Our Agenda:
18:00 - 19:00 - Dinner's ready
19:00 - 19:45 - Randy Gupta: Service Meshes with Istio
19:45 - 20:30 - Robert Tingirică: MFA for kubernetes
20:30 - … Clubmate, Beer and great discussions...

Big thank you to our sponsor InVision to make this awesome meetup possible!

Cheers!
GDG Cloud Düsseldorf

name: Google Speech API and NGINX Ingress Controller for Kubernetes
description:
We, the GDG Cloud Düsseldorf, are organizing our october meetup on wednesday october 17th at InVision. We are happy to announce top speakers from NGINX and codecentric!

Jonas Verhoelen and Tobias Trelle from codecentric AG are giving an introduction to Google Gloud machine learning APIs for speech recognition and text analysis. They will present an overview of the GCP APIs, show use cases and do some live demos.

Michael Pleshakov from NGINX will present NGINX as an Ingress Controller for Kubernetes. This talk is for Kubernetes users, looking to deliver applications on Kubernetes in production. By the end of the talk we will successfully load balance HTTP as well as TCP/UDP applications on Kubernetes with NGINX Ingress Controller. You will see how to:

- install the Ingress Controller through Kubernetes manifests or Helm;
- configure the Ingress Controller to load balance HTTP and TCP/UDP applications;
- monitor the Ingress Controller using Prometheus;
- troubleshoot the Ingress Controller in case of problems;
- extend the Ingress Controller to support advanced load balancing requirements.

Our Agenda:
18:00 - 19:00 - Dinner's ready
19:00 - 19:45 - Google Cloud Machine Learning: Introduction to Speech API & Natural Language API
19:45 - 20:30 - NGINX as an Ingress Controller for Kubernetes
20:30 - … Clubmate, Beer and great discussions...

Big thank you to our sponsor InVision to make this awesome meetup possible!

Cheers!
GDG Cloud Düsseldorf

name: Firebase with Alex Memering and Arthur Thompson (Google)
description:
We, the GDG Cloud Düsseldorf, are organizing our november meetup on saturday november 3rd at InVision. We are happy to announce Alex Memering and Arthur Thompson from Google's Firebase team!

Alex and Arthur are in Europe for the Firebase Summit in Prague and we are happy they accepted our invitation to Düsseldorf!

Alex will talk about: Using Firebase and GCP together

Firebase gives you many tools to help build user facing applications, but sometime you need more control. We'll discuss some easy ways to leverage GCP products from existing Firebase projects. We'll also talk about how to best propagate those changes back to Firebase and your applications.

Arthur will talk about: Cross Platform Messaging with FCM

Different platforms have different messaging requirements even if you want to send them the same message. With FCM HTTP v1 API you can target multiple platforms with a single request and I'll show you how.

Our Agenda:
18:00 - 19:00 - Dinner's ready
19:00 - 19:45 - Alex Memering: Using Firebase and GCP together
19:45 - 20:30 - Arthur Thompson: Cross Platform Messaging with FCM
20:30 - … Clubmate, Beer and great discussions...

Big thank you to our sponsors InVision and Google to make this awesome meetup possible!

Cheers!
GDG Cloud Düsseldorf

name: GDG Cloud Meetup - Let's talk traefik, Going Serverless with Knative
description:
We, the GDG Cloud Düsseldorf, are organizing our first meetup in 2019 meetup on tuesday january 8th at InVision. We will welcome Manuel Zapf from codecentric who is maintainer of traefik, the famous reverse proxy and load balancer.

Manuel will talk about: traefik

Google Cloud Kubernetes Engine (GKE) is a great and easy way to start exploring the powerful world of K8s without having to worry about creating a cluster completely on your own. We will introduce Traefik as an Ingress Controller for a freshly created cluster and show the power of it combined with the benefits of GKE.

The supporting act will be provided by Randy Gupta (Google Developer Expert) presentating Knative.

Knative is a developer friendly project build on top of kubernetes and istio that allows developers to deploy code directly to the cluster and run it even with zero replicas scaling on demand. This presentation will discuss and demonstrate the features of Knative.

Our Agenda:
18:00 - 19:00 - Dinner's ready
19:00 - 19:45 - Going Serverless with Knative
19:45 - 20:30 - Manuel Zapf: traefik
20:30 - … Clubmate, Beer and great discussions...

Big thank you to our sponsors InVision to make this awesome meetup possible!

Cheers!
GDG Cloud Düsseldorf

name: Cloud Study Jam - Kubernetes Solutions
description:
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!

Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge.

Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs.

You will get hands-on experience with Kubernetes.

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home.

Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to complete any labs you want

The session: https://google.qwiklabs.com/quests/45

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)!

Don’t forget your charger.

Tentative Agenda:

- 18:00 - 19:00: Dinner’s ready
- 18:30 - 18:55: Office Tour
- 19:00 - 19:10: Intro by Randy Gupta
- 19:10 - 21:00: Cloud Study Jam - Kubernetes Solutions
- 20:30 - 22:00: Drinks and great Discussions
